result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Joseph E. Glenetske
Current: 205 Lawrence St., Schofield, WI 54476 United States  (Effective: 01-23-2015)
Prior: 121 Fulmer Street Apt. #3, Schofield, WI 54476 United States

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 1:55 p.m. 
**Includes 14CF667, 14CF1019 & 14CM1548**
State appears by ADA Elisabeth Gramer. Defendant appears in person with Atty James Kurszewski.  
Court notes Information was not filed in 14CF667 & 14CF1019. Court also notes Waiver of Preliminary hearing was not filed in either case. ADA Gramer to file Information on both cases by close on 01/05/15. Atty Kurszewski files Waiver of Preliminary Hearing in 14CF667 & 14CF1019. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights and Notice to Seek Postconviction relief filed.  VRCW.
State moves to: 14CF667- DRI Ct.2> Carrying a Concealed Weapon 
                           14CM1548- DRI Ct.2> Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription            
                           14CF1019- DRI Ct.1> Bail Jumping (Felony)
                                               DRI Ct.2> Retail Theft
                                               DRI Ct.3> Bail Jumping (Misd)                                                                                             
COURT GRANTS. 
PLEA: 14CF667-  Ct. 1 Burglary (PTAC)>>NO CONTEST 
           14CM1548- Ct. 1 Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription>>NO CONTEST 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty of Ct.1 in 14CF667 & Ct.1 in 14CM1548. 
COURT ORDERS: 14CF667, Ct.1 & 14CM1548, Ct.1- SWH 2 years probation concurrent, counseling/assessment/treatment as deemed appropriate by agent, good faith effort to obtain and maintain full time employment, schooling or combination of both, letter of apology to victims Lisa & Michael Walter, no contact with Lisa & Michael Walter, 40 hours community service, CC & DNA surcharge on both files. DNA sample ordered in 14CF667. 1 day jail credit if revoked. 
Voter Ineligibility Notice and Acknowledgment signed by defendant and filed. 
Adj: 2:18 p.m.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
